body.p: “The stairs of the old back part are white pine or spruce “,” each the half of a square log; [image] those of the cellar in front “,” oak “,” of the same form. There is no ridge-pole whatever “,” –not even a board “,” –but a steep roof; and some of the rafters are oak saplings “,” hewn and showing a good deal of bark “,” and scarcely three inches diameter at the small end; yet they have sufficed.”
PE 13, pg. 279 / 25 November 1857-4 June 1858/ NNPM MA 1302:31 / T vol. # XXV / PDF # XVI / JX
